  "title": "Sales and Marketing Manager",
  "description": "Mosra Energy Limited Nigeria (MEL) is a well-established coal mining company with over 15 years experience in the industry. We are operating coal mines in Kogi and Delta States. In addition to our current operations, we have several other coal blocks under exploration in Nsukka/Udenu, Enugu State, Dekina LGA, Kogi State, and Ogbadibo LGA, Benue State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Sales and Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Sales and Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing commercial strategies to drive revenue growth, expand market presence, and optimize product sales across domestic and international markets.
	The role requires strong knowledge of the mining value chain, commodity markets, pricing mechanisms, customer relationship management, and regulatory compliance within the solid minerals sector.
	The successful candidate will lead sales planning, contract negotiations, market intelligence, branding, and customer engagement to ensure sustainable profitability and long-term market positioning of the company&rsquo;s mineral products.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales strategies for coal and/or metallic mineral products in line with company objectives.
	Identify and secure new customers, distributors, off-takers, and strategic partners locally and internationally.
	Drive revenue growth through effective pricing strategies, volume optimization, and contract management.
	Prepare and negotiate sales agreements, supply contracts, and memoranda of understanding (MOUs).
	Conduct market research to analyze demand trends, pricing benchmarks, competitor activities, and emerging markets.
	Monitor global commodity prices and advise management on market opportunities and risks.
	Identify new applications and value-added opportunities for mineral products.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients, government agencies, regulators, and industry stakeholders.
	Ensure timely resolution of customer issues, complaints, and delivery challenges.
	Coordinate with logistics and operations teams to ensure seamless order fulfillment and customer satisfaction.
	Develop and implement marketing plans to strengthen brand visibility and market penetration.
	Represent the company at industry conferences, exhibitions, trade fairs, and investor forums.
	Oversee marketing materials, product presentations, and corporate communications related to sales activities.
	Work closely with mine operations to align production planning with market demand and sales forecasts.
	Collaborate with finance to manage invoicing, receivables, credit controls, and revenue reporting.
	Ensure compliance with all regulatory, export, and documentation requirements related to mineral sales.
	Lead, mentor, and supervise the sales and marketing team to achieve performance targets.
	Prepare periodic sales forecasts, performance reports, and market analysis for management review.
	Set KPIs and monitor team performance against agreed targets.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 7 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Sales and Marketing Manager Job at Mosra Energy Limited




        
    

        
        Mosra Energy Limited Nigeria (MEL) is a well-established coal mining company with over 15 years experience in the industry. We are operating coal mines in Kogi and Delta States. In addition to our current operations, we have several other coal blocks under exploration in Nsukka/Udenu, Enugu State, Dekina LGA, Kogi State, and Ogbadibo LGA, Benue State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Manager

Job Location:  Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Sales and Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing commercial strategies to drive revenue growth, expand market presence, and optimize product sales across domestic and international markets.
	The role requires strong knowledge of the mining value chain, commodity markets, pricing mechanisms, customer relationship management, and regulatory compliance within the solid minerals sector.
	The successful candidate will lead sales planning, contract negotiations, market intelligence, branding, and customer engagement to ensure sustainable profitability and long-term market positioning of the company’s mineral products.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales strategies for coal and/or metallic mineral products in line with company objectives.
	Identify and secure new customers, distributors, off-takers, and strategic partners locally and internationally.
	Drive revenue growth through effective pricing strategies, volume optimization, and contract management.
	Prepare and negotiate sales agreements, supply contracts, and memoranda of understanding (MOUs).
	Conduct market research to analyze demand trends, pricing benchmarks, competitor activities, and emerging markets.
	Monitor global commodity prices and advise management on market opportunities and risks.
	Identify new applications and value-added opportunities for mineral products.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients, government agencies, regulators, and industry stakeholders.
	Ensure timely resolution of customer issues, complaints, and delivery challenges.
	Coordinate with logistics and operations teams to ensure seamless order fulfillment and customer satisfaction.
	Develop and implement marketing plans to strengthen brand visibility and market penetration.
	Represent the company at industry conferences, exhibitions, trade fairs, and investor forums.
	Oversee marketing materials, product presentations, and corporate communications related to sales activities.
	Work closely with mine operations to align production planning with market demand and sales forecasts.
	Collaborate with finance to manage invoicing, receivables, credit controls, and revenue reporting.
	Ensure compliance with all regulatory, export, and documentation requirements related to mineral sales.
	Lead, mentor, and supervise the sales and marketing team to achieve performance targets.
	Prepare periodic sales forecasts, performance reports, and market analysis for management review.
	Set KPIs and monitor team performance against agreed targets.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 7 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to: hr@mosraenerji.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.

In addition to our current operations, we have several other coal blocks under exploration in Nsukka/Udenu, Enugu State, Dekina LGA, Kogi State, and Ogbadibo LGA, Benue State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Objective
     

            
    




	Are you passionate about building scalable, high-performing applications that transform how the power and electricity sector operates?
	We are looking for a Software Engineer – Java to join our innovative development team
	You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable, secure, and efficient applications that enable utility companies to enhance operational performance, customer experience, and revenue assurance.

	Stay updated with the latest technologies in IoT, SCADA, data analytics, and power automation systems relevant to electricity utilities.

	First degree in Computer Science, Engineering or technical skills required for this role
	Minimum of 5 - 6 years of software development experience, preferably in energy, power, or utilities-focused software projects.
	Proven experience with software solutions for power distribution, metering, or energy billing systems.
	Strong proficiency in one or more programming languages: Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript (Node.js, React, or Angular).

	MySQL

Videographer / Content Creator Job at International Facilities Services Limited




        
    

        
        International Facilities Services (IFS) is an International Facilities Management company operating in global standards to a wide range of clients in Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa and the Middle East.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer / Content Creator

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	For Bold Storytellers. Visual Rebels. Creative Thinkers.
	This Is Not a “Just Film and Edit” Role.
	We’re looking for a visual storyteller—someone who sees moments before they happen, frames stories instinctively, and edits with emotion, rhythm, and purpose.
	If you think in shots, sequences, beats, and narratives—and you’re bored of cookie-cutter content—this role is for you.
	If you can make maintenance "sexy", you are the one.


What You’ll Create


	Short-form, scroll-stopping videos for online and traditional media exposure including podcast recording
	Corporate stories that don’t feel corporate
	Brand films, behind-the-scenes content, event highlights
	Content that makes people stop, watch, and remember
	You’ll own the full journey: concept → shoot → edit → create.


Your Playground (What You’ll Do)
Shoot:


	Capture cinematic and dynamic footage (not flat, not boring)
	Play with angles, movement, lighting, and sound
	Turn everyday moments into compelling visuals.


Edit:


	Transform raw footage into punchy, emotional, or powerful stories
	Add rhythm, motion, captions, sound design, and subtle effects
	Adapt content for LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, and internal platforms.


Create:


	Bring ideas to the table—we want your brain, not just your hands
	Challenge briefs and suggest better visual approaches
	Experiment, iterate, and push creative boundaries.


Who You Are


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 years of experience.
	A creative thinker who loves visual storytelling
	Comfortable breaking rules (when it serves the story)
	Skilled in video editing tools (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci, etc.)
	Strong eye for composition, pacing, and emotion
	Can manage deadlines without killing creativity.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.
